title: Fullstack Developer
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Job Title** 
 : Fullstack Developer
   

  

**Location** 
 : Sweden (On-Site) - Nacka Strand, Stockholm
   

  

**Employment Type** 
 : Full-Time
   

  

**Important Note** 
 : This position requires full-time on-site presence at our Stockholm office. Only candidates who are current residents of Sweden will be considered.
   

  

**About CharpstAR**
 CharpstAR is a Swedish technology company at the forefront of transforming e-commerce experiences through cutting-edge 3D, AR, and virtual try-on solutions. We empower businesses with innovative tools to showcase their products in immersive ways
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are looking for a
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 with 1–3 years of experience to join our Stockholm team. As part of a small but growing team, you'll play a key role in developing innovative solutions for e-commerce clients, using modern web technologies, 3D programming, and cloud infrastructure.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build and maintain scalable, high-performance applications using Next.js and related frameworks.
* Work with Supabase for backend development, integrating APIs and optimizing database interactions.
* Collaborate on exciting projects that involve 3D programming
* Deploy, manage, and optimize applications using AWS and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Work closely with designers and project managers to deliver intuitive and responsive user experiences.
* Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies to ensure our solutions are cutting-edge.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience: 1–3 years as a Fullstack Developer or similar role.
* Proficiency in Next.js: You have a deep understanding of its features, architecture, and ecosystem.
* Database and Backend Knowledge: Experience with Supabase or equivalent backend solutions.
* 3D Programming Skills: Familiarity with Three.js is a big plus, but not mandatory.
* Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with AWS and/or GCP is a significant advantage.
* Problem Solver: You have a knack for identifying challenges and implementing effective solutions.
* Team Player: Strong collaboration and communication skills.


**What We Offer**
* A chance to be part of an innovative tech company with a strong foothold in Sweden
* Opportunities to work on state-of-the-art 3D and AR solutions for leading e-commerce brands.
* Professional growth in a fast-paced and creative environment.
* Competitive salary

title: Software Engineer (.NET Core) - Hybrid - Stockholm Or Malmö Or Madrid
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 This role is a hybrid role and is open to candidates located in Stockholm or Malmo or Madrid.
   

  

 If you're a Software Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Software Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
   

  

 Please send your application in English language. Thank you!

title: Junior Product Developer for Women H&M
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 
  

  

 As a Jr Product Developer you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of creating women’s collections to be sold in all our sales countries – all over the world. Together with a tight team, you work with identifying and developing collections, according to current and upcoming global trends. Your main responsibility is to support the Product Developer, creating the best products to our customers. You will be the important link between designers, pattern makers and planners throughout the entire process and make things happen around you. We therefore think that you are a true star when it comes to administrative tasks and sample handling, and love to work when no day is the same and the pace is fast. Here you will get the chance to be part of daily operational tasks and learn from experienced colleagues.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Qualifications:
   

  

* Degree within textile and/or product development and/or similar
* Working as a Junior Buyer or Junior Product Developer
* Have passion for women’s customer and current fashion products
* Experience and competence within product development
* Driven and ambitious
* Strong salesmanship and see opportunities for growth and profitability
* Being structured, organized and take initiatives
* Being a team player with a flexible attitude
* See possibilities, improvements, and simple solutions


**Who We Are**
 At the Womenswear Assortment, you will be part of a fast pace environment and work with a current assortment for our customer – always with focus on quality, sustainability, and the best price. Womenswear consists of the following categories: jersey & knit, light & heavy woven, underwear, loungewear, nightwear, and swimwear
 **.** 
 You will contribute to making progress towards our vision – A loved women´s fashion destination, leading the change to a sustainable fashion future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 We are recruiting to fill several full time positions with placement in Stockholm and start as soon as possible. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV
 **latest 4th of May** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with your manager before applying.)
   

  

 Benefits:
   

  

 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
 Inclusion & Diversity:
   

  

*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*
**We look forward to hearing from you!**

title: Frontend Developer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**Shape the future of golf technology by creating new features that expand how our partners use and benefit from Toptracer’s innovations.** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





**THE ROLE** 




 All around the world, golf players are perfecting their swings at driving ranges—many of them powered by Toptracer’s world-leading ball-tracing technology. Our innovative solutions not only enhance the player experience but also provide range operators with powerful tools to manage their business.
 



  





 We’re looking for a Frontend Developer to join our cross-functional team and contribute to two key products. In this role, you'll work primarily with Angular 19 on a modern, well-structured codebase, built with the latest tools and best practices to ensure a clean, maintainable, and high-quality development environment. You’ll play a pivotal role in refining our frontend architecture, making technical decisions, and driving best practices to create impactful and intuitive solutions for both businesses and players.
 



  





**PRODUCTS** 




  





**Toptracer Range Management System (TRMS)** 
 is the admin tool that empowers range owners to manage and operate their facilities with Toptracer’s cutting-edge technology. Our team is dedicated to building high-quality software that unlocks new opportunities for businesses of all sizes—helping them run their ranges in smarter, more efficient, and more innovative ways. At the same time, we ensure that TRMS remains a reliable and seamless tool that supports daily operations without friction.
 



  





**Toptracer Coach** 
 is an online platform designed to revolutionize the coaching experience by leveraging data from Toptracer Range games. It provides teaching professionals with powerful insights into a player’s skill level, using game modes as objective baseline assessments. From there, they can assign drills, track student progress, analyze session data, and create personalized, data-driven lesson plans that drive real improvement.
 



  





**POSSIBILITIES** 



* Be part of a cross-functional team with end-to-end product ownership, driving development from idea to implementation and beyond.
* Shape the future of golf technology by creating new features that expand how our partners use and benefit from Toptracer’s innovations.
* Collaborate with like-minded developers, designers, and product experts in an environment that values creativity, autonomy, and shared success.
* Experience our “Live-with-the-product” sessions, where we test the latest improvements firsthand—and maybe even improve our own golf game! (No prior golf experience required.)



  





**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE** 



* 7+ years of software development experience, including professional experience with Angular, ideally with recent versions.
* An agile mindset with a strong focus on quality, recognizing that frequent and reliable value delivery depends on well-structured code, thoughtful design, and a proactive approach to quality assurance.
* A strong frontend architectural mindset, with experience designing scalable and maintainable solutions.
* A collaborative approach, thriving in cross-functional teams and working closely with developers, designers, and product owners.
* A passion for both code and product, contributing not just to the codebase but also to the team’s success and the user experience.



  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Software Engineer - Intern
description:
**Vantel (YC W25)** 

 is hiring an exceptional technical student to join as our first ever intern. This is a rare opportunity to build from 0→1 directly alongside the founders.
 




  






 We’re building AI-native software for commercial insurance brokers, starting with a product that automates policy review and transforms hours of manual work into minutes. Brokers love it. The industry needs it.
 




  






 We’re backed by world-class investors, including Y Combinator and the early backers of Spotify, Airbnb, Revolut, Brex, and several other $10B+ companies.
 




  





**Commercial insurance is 1% of global GDP** 

 and a foundational layer of society. We're working with some of the top minds in the industry to modernize it. We are building a company on a global scale, applying state-of-the-art technology to one of the world's most traditional industries. This is one of the most ambitious efforts in the space—and we want the world’s most ambitious people.
 




  




**Why join?** 
* Top-of-market salary. We believe the best people should be rewarded like it.
* Immediate impact. You’ll ship to users and help shape the foundation of a category-defining company.
* Work and learn directly alongside the founders and elite engineers. Our team includes ex-Microsoft engineers, ex-QuantumBlack data scientists, insurance insiders and world-class ML researchers who have built and sold insurance tech before.



  




**What you’ll do** 
* Build production code across the stack (Python/FastAPI + React/TypeScript on AWS)
* Work on core product features and LLM pipelines
* Think from first principles to help us build a truly revolutionary product



  




**About you** 
* You are likely at the top of your class studying a hard science (engineering, CS, mathematics, physics, …) at a top university in Sweden or abroad
* You’ve been building software for a few years with demonstrated interest in full-stack development and LLMs outside of school; e.g., personal projects or work experience
* You want to work on hard problems with a small, elite team
* You’re wired for speed, ownership, and ambition



  






 If you are a future startup founder, this is a rare opportunity to see the insides of what building a generational company looks like at the early stages. We also offer potential to convert the internship into a full-time role.
 




  






 Location: In-person in Stockholm
 





 Duration: Summer 2025 (Start and end dates flexible)

title: Fullstack Developer (Node.js, React, AWS)
description:
We’re not just any bank – we’re Qred, a cutting-edge, tech-driven force on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses in 7 markets across northern Europe. With our innovative solutions, we’re making it easier for entrepreneurs to access the capital they need to grow and thrive. As we scale, we are now looking for a Fullstack Developer to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack developer at Qred, you’ll be a part of a cross-functional team together with fellow Qredsters from diverse technical backgrounds. Our teams are carefully structured to promote collaboration and accountability, bringing together developers and UX designers to efficiently solve daily challenges and take ownership of the products we build. Each team is right-sized and well-structured, led by an Engineering Manager, Product Manager and Tech Lead, ensuring that everyone is included, aligned and moving in the same direction.
   

  

 We trust in our developer’s capability of implementing, testing, reviewing, deploying daily and operating their software in production.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A flexible and positive mindset as well as a strong team spirit
* Around 2-4 years of experience in writing, releasing and maintaining web applications as well as integrations, using the following techs: Node.js, React and Amazon Web Services


**What Will Make You Stand Out**
* Experience working with Agile methodologies
* Familiarity with CloudFormation or CDK
* Hands-on knowledge of CI/CD tools such as Circle-ci, GitHub actions or similar
* Experience with the fintech industry


**Why join us?**
 First of all, this is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action.
   

  

 In addition to our great culture influenced by our values Transparency, Innovation and Passion, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from and get to know!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans, factoring and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fuelled by international expansion.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Frontend Developer - Stockholm - Health Tech Start-Up** 




  





 Our client is on a mission to give children the best start in life and is looking for a Frontend Developer to join their growing team.
 



  





 They’ve just secured €2M in funding and are building a React Native-based platform that will have a real impact on children's health. Their product uses AI and LLM to secure the next generation's gut health and allergy patterns.
 



  





 Now that the product has been launched, their growing team of 5 is looking for a Frontend Developer to start building the product with the team to the best possible quality.
 



  





**Responsiblities** 



* Lead the development of new features and products, working closely with both technical and non-technical team members to bring the company's vision to life.
* Build scalable and maintainable mobile and web applications from the ground up, focusing on frontend development.
* Maintain and troubleshoot mobile and web applications, conduct frontend and backend testing, and ensure seamless integrations.
* Collaborate with product managers and developers across the frontend and backend to enhance system performance.
* Adapt and refine products based on customer feedback to improve user experience.



  





**Requirements** 



* Multiple years of experience working with React Native using Expo
* A good understanding of how and when to build in-house, compared to using one of the many packages you’d find on NPM.
* An understanding of what joining a startup means, both in what it requires from you, and the benefits



  





 This is a great opportunity to help improve the quality of life of children and their families, potentially actually saving lives.

title: Frontend developer / Product engineer
description:
About Datastory
 
 Datastory (www.datastory.tech) is on a mission to curate, visualize, and explain knowledge so that more people find that spark to use and learn from data ✨. Our platform transforms data (whether it’s historical events, climate change data, government documents, or artificial intelligence research) into rich, interactive experiences that millions of people will use every day.
 



 If you are equally curious about the future of civic tech, visualization, data science, and scientific communication, apply to Datastory. Here, you get to work with some of the most forward-thinking organizations and people on the planet – always with the view towards building more sustainable applications anchored in
 *Humane Tech principles* 
 .
 



  




 About the Role
 
 We’re looking for a
 **frontend developer** 
 who wants to build new product features from start to finish, using technologies like GraphQL, Github, and MobX. The features you develop will impact many users and are at the core of our product offering, such as:
 


* Our Platform experience for partners
* Data visualization tools
* UI components library
* Educational, multilingual websites



 You are a problem solver who likes to brainstorm solutions with teammates and can identify user experience issues before they ship. If needed, you can single-handedly craft effective UIs and come up with clever abstractions that save time and keep the codebase lean. You put users first and think about how to simplify their interactions with data-driven and educational content.
 



  




 A Few More Pointers About the Role
 * **Permanent and full-time** 
 position aimed at
 **mid to senior level** 
 of experience.
* We're located in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 , but we're
 **remote-first** 
 with colleagues in different countries.
* We primarily operate according to
 **Swedish office hours** 
 (9 AM to 5 PM). However, we recognize the importance of work-life balance and are flexible with working hours to accommodate individual needs.
* You’ll mainly work with other developers on the team, but you'll likely collaborate with all team members at various points.
* We are seeking
 **two frontend developers** 
 and will tailor the roles to your strengths. If interested, you may also support project managers in client meetings, particularly during requirements gathering and needs analysis.



  




 A Day in the Life Might Look Like
 * Help build our internal data visualization tool tapping into our
 **Knowledge Graph API** 
 , by working on improving its core, adding new data visualization templates, etc.
* Implement
 **UI components** 
 based on Figma design and UI/UX specifications, working on polishing all the details that make it accessible and delightful for users.
* Implement complex
 **data visualizations** 
 for our partners/clients, comprised of interactive chart(s) and a set of controls allowing users to customize it.
* Improve
 **UI library documentation** 
 , fixing errors, keeping it up to date, adding useful code examples, and filling in missing docs.
* Expand
 **test coverage** 
 of our codebase, both unit and end-to-end (e2e) tests.
* Add
 **GitHub issues** 
 , participate in RFCs and other discussions around various APIs we create or use.
* Create your own and review
 **PRs** 
 from your colleagues.



  




 Our Stack and Technology
 * **Base** 
 : TypeScript, React/Next.js, Svelte
* **UI** 
 : ChakraUI, Ant Design
* **API** 
 : Knowledge Graph exposed via GraphQL API
* **Data Visualization** 
 : D3, LayerCake/LayerChart
* **Mapping** 
 : MapboxGL, React Simple Maps
* **Testing** 
 : Jest, Cypress



  




 Skills You’ll Need to Bring
 * **Creative problem-solving skills** 
 and the ability to clearly describe concepts to non-technical clients and understand their requirements.
* **Effective planning, prioritization** 
 , and organization of your work independently, as well as in collaboration with other engineers.
* Proven ability to develop
 **efficient frontend code** 
 , ideally using frameworks like React, Svelte, or similar.
* Understanding of, and ideally experience with
 **building GraphQL or other APIs** 
 .
* A deep interest in the full-stack technology landscape and ideally other interests relevant to the Datastory mission of spreading knowledge (history, arts, geography, socioeconomics, etc.).
* Familiarity with various
 **headless Content Management Systems (CMS)** 
 is advantageous.
* Experience in
 **productization** 
 and transforming services or ideas into marketable products.
* **Excellent command of English** 
 and the ability to articulate complex ideas in pseudocode and code.



  




 Application Process
 * **Step 1** 
 : Send an email to our CTO at
 **arek@datastory.tech** 
 with the subject “Frontend Developer” and briefly explain why this role is interesting to you. Please include any materials we can use to assess your fit for the position (e.g., resume, portfolio, GitHub profile).
* **Step 2** 
 : The next step is an initial call with us where we can learn more about you and answer any questions you may have.
* **Step 3** 
 : The final step is a take-home assignment where you’ll implement a well-scoped and design-specified UI component, matching our remote-first, async workflow or participate in a technical interview.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes more than 150 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**The Real Deal About Our Team**
 We've been transforming our development culture, and we're proud of the progress. We're moving away from rigid processes toward more collaborative, effective ways of working. We believe in honest discussions about technical challenges and finding practical solutions together.
   

  

**What Makes Us Different**
* Collaborative Problem-Solving: We're building a culture where developers can solve problems together. We're introducing pairing and mob programming sessions where teams collaborate on complex challenges—we believe combining our brainpower can solve problems in days rather than weeks. We're looking for people who can help strengthen this collaborative approach.
* User-Centered Approach: We actively seek out opportunities to understand and "walk in the shoes" of our range of users, from maintenance personnel and economic administrators all the way to residents. This deep understanding of diverse user needs drives our product decisions and helps us build truly useful solutions.
* Technical Evolution: We're gradually addressing technical debt and modernizing our approach. We believe good code is a form of respect—both to our customers in the property management sector and to our fellow developers.
* Focus on Flow: We're increasingly focused on delivering continuous value rather than getting stuck in process. We're learning to limit work in progress to maintain quality and developer satisfaction.


**What You'll Actually Do Here**
* Work in small, cross-functional teams responsible for different areas of our property management and fintech solutions
* Participate in decision-making from idea to architecture to release
* Collaborate closely with customers to get feedback that drives improvements
* Think creatively to solve real problems that property managers and residents face
* Help modernize our LAMP stack, with smarter approaches and cleaner code)
* Learn how to effectively advocate for technical improvements within the larger organization—a valuable skill we actively help each other develop
* Join a team that values rapid iteration over excessive planning


**Who You Might Be**
* Someone who sees collaboration as a power tool, not a tax on productivity
* Someone who enjoys the challenge of building intuitive user interfaces that solve real problems
* A developer who understands that sometimes the best technical solution requires organizational savvy to implement
* A person who can balance pragmatism with the desire for clean, modern code
* Someone who enjoys teaching others what you know and learning what you don't


**Note: Research shows that many qualified candidates, particularly women, tend to apply only when they meet 100% of listed requirements.** 
*We believe diverse perspectives and balanced teams consistently deliver better results. Please apply even if you* 
 don't match all criteria. Your unique background, approach to problem-solving, and different ways of thinking are exactly what help our teams build more innovative and effective solutions for our customers.
   

  

**The Tech Context (Keeping It Real)**
 We currently work with LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP), Angular, and related technologies. Your experience with any tech stack is valuable, but your willingness to learn and improve our current systems is even more important. We're more interested in your problem-solving approach than specific technical knowledge.
   

  

**The Promise We're Making**
 When you join us, you're entering an environment that's committed to improvement. We work on exciting product areas that make a real impact in the PropTech and FinTech sectors. You'll be part of a team that values profitable and long-term product development, with the opportunity to influence both what we build and how we build it.
   

  

**Location**
 Our teams often have a hybrid set up and we find great value in connecting with our teams in person, most of whom are located in and around Stockholm and Gothenburg. Our headquarters in Stockholm is on the top floor of the newly built Sthlm 04, offering stunning views over the city.
   

  

**Want to Be Part of This?**
 If you're energized by the idea of joining a team that's serious about building quality software together and making a difference in how properties are managed, we'd love to talk. Share something you've built, tell us about how you've collaborated effectively, or just let us know what excites you about building meaningful software.
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software

title: Backend developer
description:
We are looking for senior backend engineers to join us and expand our team of talented backend developers. You share a passion for building systems that delivers high business value without sacrificing maintainability, availability, scalability and quality. You will work on the backend systems that power our casino platform and help us deliver the best customer experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and help operate our systems
* Drive technical improvements throughout the stack
* Together with product teams deliver the best games and business solutions
* Help scale our solution to customer requirements and business opportunities


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience working in a mixed Java, SQL, Javascript environment
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning
* You are curious, driven and not afraid to take charge and improve the system and add automation where needed
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in
* You have experience from working on large Java systems and have a solid understanding of performance, scalability and availability challenges of distributed systems
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* You know your way around a modern Unix/Linux system
* Experience with modern deployment, monitoring and logging solutions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Role - Senior Full Stack Engineer
 



 Duration - Circa 8 months
 



 Workplace type - Hybrid
 



 Location - Stockholm
 



  





 Our client is seeking a Full Stack Engineer to join their agile development team and play a key role in supporting A/B testing initiatives across digital platforms. As one of Europe’s leading energy companies, Our client is committed to enabling fossil-free living within one generation, with a strong focus on innovation, user experience, and sustainable technology.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll work closely with UX/UI designers, developers, and business stakeholders to build and enhance scalable, secure, and high-performing solutions that drive data-informed decision-making through experimentation. This is an exciting opportunity for a technically skilled and collaborative developer who is passionate about full stack engineering and delivering real impact through continuous testing and optimization.
 



  





 Your main responsibilities are:
 


* Experience of developing and designing robust and sustainable IT Solutions
* To act as a bridge between business and technical knowledge
* Collaborate with software developer peers, UX-designers, business experts and Product Owner
* Your software development is according to best practice principles
* Support coding standards and adhere to best practice standards
* Work closely with developer peers to establish an efficient framework of executing A/B testing in our existing code
* Use, ensure and implement secure software development
* Be an ambassador for application solution best practices and application security
* Share your software development and solution design best practices with your peers within IT
* You are structured, self-organized, curious about contributing to A/B testing and can take initiative and communicate with stakeholders



  





 Skills:
 


* More than 5 years' experience as a developer
* Tech stack: Angular 15+, html, CSS, typescript, JavaScript .NET core, Microsoft Azure Cloud solutions
* Good knowledge Optimizely (EPiServer CMS) development
* MS DevOps, MS Visual studio, Git & Gitflow experience
* Automatic unit and integration testing experience
* A deep interest in driving value-creating software development and innovation
* English fluently both oral and written, Swedish is a bonus
* 3 years of experience in Agile frameworks and agile software development
* Custom JavaScript DOM Manipulation
* Modifying page elements in real-time using JavaScript
* Client-side implementation with small backend changes
* Feature Flagging & Experimentation
* Server-side testing using conditional logic in your codebase
* Enable testing of fundamental functionality changes
* Improve performance and eliminate flicker effects
* Future-focused approach for sophisticated testing



  





 Offer:
 


* Freelance contract (8 months)
* Hybrid working in Stockholm
* Work with an agile, product-driven team in a highly innovative environment

title: Full-stack Developer
description:
Join as a visionary Full Stack Developer, leading transformative development with integrated solutions across front and back-end, bridging the technology-business gap and shaping the future with innovative user experiences.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Join as a Full Stack Developer and lead transformative development, crafting innovative solutions across front and back-end with integrated services and APIs. Embrace your leadership role, creating conceptual architecture to meet precise client needs, while bridging the technology-business gap with exceptional communication. Elevate your career in this dynamic journey of Full Stack Development, shaping the future and making a lasting impact on clients. Together we do what matters.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
 Programming: C# / .NET, JavaScript/TypeScript Service Development: building web applications and web APIs using ASP.Net and cloud services (Azure/AWS/GCP) Cloud: Azure and others Database: (worked with one or more of) SQL Server, Azure SQL, Entity Framework Design & Style: HTML5, Responsive/Adaptive Design, CSS3, Bootstrap Frameworks: (Worked with one or more of) Angular, React, NodeJS, Vue.js, or equivalent JavaScript DevOps: Git, Azure DevOps
   

  

**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role Embrace challenges with a keen intellect and a thirst for knowledge. Collaborate seamlessly, fostering open and effective communication. Embrace creativity and explore groundbreaking solutions. Stay ahead of the curve, anticipating what lies ahead and adapting to the latest advancements.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 Analyze, design, develop, implement and maintain application code in a variety of contexts. Use .NET and Azure ecosystem to build scalable applications which power modern framework-driven web apps. Build and automate the features and services that model complex business problems, power enterprise-scale systems and drive innovative user experiences. Implement APIs and Microservices through database design, data access and ORMs and consume said APIs to build feature-rich applications. Develop scalable and cloud-based solutions, with consideration to security and performance. Harness modern development and Azure DevOps practices including CI/CD, containerization, automated testing.
   

  

**Learn more**
 Interested to hear more? Apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade: Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications). Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally. Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth. Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you.
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!

title: Junior C++ Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Development is the largest discipline at Endava. Our developers design, build, and release software products in multiple programming languages, frameworks, and libraries. Always collaborating with cross-functional project teams, our developers are adaptable problem-solvers with a client-oriented mindset.
   

  

 As a Junior C++ Developer at Endava, you will collaborate with senior developers and work on building and maintaining Telecom software applications. You will be responsible for writing clean, efficient code and learning from experienced team members to develop your technical skills.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Assist in developing, testing, and deploying Telecom software applications.
* Write clean, scalable, and efficient code based on requirements.
* Participate in code reviews and follow best practices for software development.
* Collaborate with the team to design and implement new features.
* Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues in existing software.
* Assist in maintaining and updating existing applications and codebase.
* Stay up to date with new programming techniques, technologies, and trends.
* Work closely with geographically distributed cross-functional teams, including design, QA, and project management, to ensure high-quality software delivery.
* Document code and processes for future reference and team collaboration


**Qualifications**
* Understanding of different common programming paradigms (OOP, Functional, etc.).
* Knowledge of as many as possible of the following programming languages, frameworks, and DevOps tools.
* Familiarity with database systems and SQL.
* Understanding of version control systems like Git or similar.
* Awareness of Agile methodologies and CI/CD practices.
* Good communication and teamwork abilities.
* Fluent English & Swedish proficiency.


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 Our diversity makes us stronger - it drives meaningful change and enables us to build innovative technology solutions. We are committed to creating an inclusive community where all of us, regardless of background, identity, or personal characteristics, feels valued, respected, and free from discrimination. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all individuals and base hiring decisions on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled Fullstack Developer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web services and UIs that serve millions of users worldwide, for example our platforms for (UniFi OS, Design Center/InnerSpace, Accounts or Community)
* Collaborate with developers and designers in distributed teams in an agile and fast-paced, international work environment
* Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions
* Maintain industry-standard programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience of coding in modern JavaScript, TypeScript, React and Node.js
* Experience of building scalable and high-availability GraphQL/REST APIs and working with SQL databases (Postgres) and key-value stores/message brokers such as Redis
* Solid knowledge about programming, design patterns and web protocols
* Experience of debugging, profiling and optimising web apps
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Ability to lead yourself and your own work as well as collaborate extensively with others
* Familiar with Git and Jira
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Skilled in Go and/or Java
* Experience developing AWS cloud services / DevOps
* Good understanding of networking protocols and architectures
* Familiarity with the agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: Java Software Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:

The company is stable and flourishing, housing a team of senior engineers who are at the forefront of their fields. We are now looking for a Senior Java Developer to join their busy, growing and successful team.
 



  





**Senior Java Developer** 




  





 Stockholm OR Gothenburg
 



 SEK 52-62K per month plus bonus and excellent benefits package.
 



  





 You must have a valid work permit for Sweden to apply for this role.
 



  





**To be successful in this role:** 




 You will be a confident and senior Java Developer with 5+ years of experience with Java and its ecosystem. You will have consultancy experience and enjoy communicating with stakeholders during project delivery.
 



  





 Other requirements for this role include:

 As a Senior Java Developer, you will have the opportunity to create innovative solutions and manage a diverse range of stakeholders.  The business prides itself on fostering a vibrant and supportive company culture characterized by collaboration, innovation, and mutual respect. Additionally, you will be provided numerous opportunities for career progression, supported by continuous skills development and a platform to build your consulting profile. title: Software Engineer
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding - you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Create the infrastructure for evroc’s other engineering teams and customers to build on. Our team is responsible for cloud storage in all its different forms as well as authentication and access management, logging and altering.
* Create Infrastructure-as-Code deployments for internal and customer services supporting very large scale cluster configurations.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack.
* Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Forge and refine tools that power team efficiency - this includes CI/CD, local development setups, build toolchains, and essential infrastructure.
* Plot the roadmap for software component development, aligning with team priorities and vision.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Coding in programming languages such as C, C++, Golang, Rust or Java.
* Experience in building and enhancing compute, storage, and data platforms with exposure to open source products like Kubernetes, Knative, Ceph, Rook and the like.
* Hands-on with infrastructure-as-code tools and automation, such as Terraform, Ansible, or Helm.
* Familiarity with software build processes and secure supply systems, like OpenSSF.
* Active engagement or contributions to the open-source community.


 Please note you do not need to have experience with all of the technologies listed above to apply. If your background is in back-end development and distributed systems, and you are passionate about building a better cloud, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Full stack developer (.NET/Angular) | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?
   

  

**About The Job**
 SEB is working firm with our digital transformation where we need your help to shape the future of the bank.
   

  

 Core Custody department are part of Custody & Investments Solution area within Technology, developing IT solutions in close cooperation with stakeholders in different business areas.
   

  

 The Safekeeping team is based in Solna. You will be a part of an agile team of highly motivated and creative colleagues that works in close collaboration with our product owners and business specialists. Cross collaboration and interaction with other teams within Technology with focus on our delivery is also part of the work.The team’s main responsibility is to develop and maintain systems supporting post trade management and transfers of securities.
   

  

 Our technical environment is a microservices architecture with responsive design for new development. Our stack includes C#, .NET Core, Angular, and JavaScript/TypeScript. We use Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenShift for containerization. For version control we useGitHub and GitHub Actions for CI/CD.
   

  

**Who we are looking for?**
 To succeed in your role with us you should behighly motivated to participate in a change journey with a long-term perspective. We also expectyou to take an active accountability for your work and for the wider team’s performance to deliver superiorservice quality to the internal counterparties and stakeholders.
   

  

 Also, you will need to have:
   

  

* worked as C# .NET developer for several years
* preferably experienced working with front end technologies such as Angular or React
* a university-level education in a field related to Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a closely related subject


**We Also Value**
* experience in microservices and Single Page Applications
* prior experience in integrating Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) solutions with internal systems
* a passion for development and like to learn new technologies, platforms, and tools
* a team player personality that understands the importance of teamwork and agile way of working
* a creative and curious mindset


**What We Offer**
 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Excellent office environment
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-04-10. If you have questions about the position, please contact Manager Malena Langley at malena.langley@seb.se
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to our
 **User Platform Team** 
 for our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you will have the opportunity to build the most sought-after streaming service in the Nordics. You will be at the forefront of digital media and develop the platform for our continuously growing user base. Your engagement will shape the future of our service as you will be involved in defining the future for video on demand and live streaming. You will be part of growing the platform, enhance our user experience, and create the next generation of streaming services.
   

  

 We thrive in using the latest technology, always keeping up to date and constantly develop our ways of working. We work with Node.js and Rust in a micro-services architecture that runs in AWS. Also, we build our whole product here in-house.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for a team player that wants to join us building strong and high performing solutions. We take care of our services mainly for the user authentication journey that are built primarily in Node.js using both instances and serverless using an event driven architecture that are deployed in AWS. Our ways of working emphasizes a shared ownership approach where we learn from each other.
   

  

**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with frontend development


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Product & Tech organisation
 





 Our Product & Technology organisation drives the development of Trustly’s products. The cross functional teams collectively work with innovative ideas, development of products and platform and set the vision and strategy for the problem spaces they own. The Product & Tech
 

 organisation
 

 consists of a bit more than 200 people spread across Stockholm, Lisbon, Örebro, Paris, London and Izmir. 
 









 All teams consist of a product manager, an engineering manager, a lead developer and engineers. Some teams also have designers and analytics competence in the team. They all work closely together to enable new products and features within existing products within Europe and to make sure the payment platform runs without interruptions and with high performance.
 








**About the role
 





 We are now looking to strengthen our engineering capacity within Product & Technology with one more senior backend engineer.
 

 We operate in an agile culture combined with DevOps, allowing our teams to take on full responsibility from code to on-call.
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* In your role as a senior backend engineer, you will play a key role in developing, maintaining and improving our platform and digital products
* Be a part of our development team and build new product features, as well as our next-generation system platform
* Develop and build scalable systems together with our engineering teams, ensuring high quality in automation and monitoring
* Work closely with other engineers, lead devs, engineering managers and product managers on a daily basis, understanding and conveying the business value in what we build and why we build it
* Be a key team member and a role model for other engineers, enabling others to thrive



  




**Who you are:** 
* 5+ years of experience working with Java and building robust and scalable systems in agile environments
* Comfortable in full lifecycle development, from drafting application design to implementing and supporting it
* Experienced in service-based architecture and microservices
* Experienced in SQL, Kubernetes, Linux, Kafka, Docker or Spring boot
* Experienced working with cloud based solutions (preferably AWS), monitoring and analytics
* Strong ability to understand and articulate complex problems
* Proficient in troubleshooting complex systems
* Experienced with high-availability, high-transactions systems in production
* Passionate for working in a DevOps environment, considering ownership and excellence fundamental parts of development
* Interested in researching and introducing new technologies to drive innovation in your team
* Committed to build quality in, with experience in test-driven development and various levels of testing
* t’s a plus if you have experience with modern frontend frameworks, for example React
* Fluent in English






  




  


**What's in it for you?
 
**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact** 
 : A role where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously take on exciting new challenges.
 







**Fantastic Benefits** 
 :
 



**30 days of holiday** 
  for a healthy work-life balance depending location.
 



**Monthly team outing allowance** 
  to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



**Parental leave top-up** 
 , supporting you during family milestones
 



**Health & Wellness allowance** 
 of 5000 SEK per year
 



**Daily breakfast** 
  and other on-site perks to make your day that much easier
 



 Plus many more benefits designed to support your well-being! 🌟
 



  





**Our Fantastic Benefits**




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 







**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.********

title: Senior Software Engineer - Fullstack
description:
**Why is this role important**
 We’re building the world’s largest, most capable, and performant data platform for Marketing Intelligence. We have accomplished a lot, but we’re still early in our journey. Now, we are looking for Software Engineers to help us tackle the challenges ahead. If you’re curious to learn more about our data platform, here’s a blog post from our CTO.
   

  

*Our engineering department*
 We put a strong emphasis on team collaboration, we work in cross-functional teams, where you are not handed requirements, but rather problems to solve. Our Engineering teams have clear ownership and room to make decisions and priorities for our product. You engage and take responsibility for your part of the product with your peers. Learning is central to us. We work with small iterations and deploy to production several times a day.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 You will work with both frontend and backend and be responsible for everything from implementation to deployment and monitoring and we expect you to follow engineering best practices.
   

  

 We currently have several openings across the organization, focusing on areas like product navigation, onboarding, and platform connections. The whole product development department works from our central office in Stockholm to make it easier to collaborate.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
* Javascript/TypeScript
* Node
* React
* Microservice architecture in AWS


**What We're Looking For**
* 6+ years experience working as a developer in, at least parts of, our tech stack.
* Proficiency in both frontend and backend but might be more passionate about either.
* Knowledge in cloud development (we use AWS) and infrastructure.
* Interest and experience in thinking of scalability, security and reliability.
* Hands-on experience in agile teams and ways of working.
* Fluency in English.


**What You'll Bring**
 You're humble and you're not afraid to make important decisions. You see challenges as opportunities for growth, embrace learning, and persist in the face of setbacks.
   

  

 You have a strong drive for customer satisfaction, and you want to contribute to the success of your team! You understand how things work together and you can figure out solutions when things get complicated.
   

  

 You believe that the best solutions come from teamwork, where diverse perspectives and open communication is key. You enjoy collaborating within and across teams, as well as with adjacent departments such as design, product, and customers.
   

  

**Benefits & Perks**
 We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits.
   

  

 → Take a look at our Funnel benefits here!
   

  

**About**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Inclusiveness**
 Industry research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups generally don’t apply to jobs unless they check all the boxes for the role. If you feel you have what it takes for this role but don’t check 100% of the boxes—that’s okay—we encourage you to apply anyway and highlight what you can bring to the table.
   

  

**Office first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**Relocation**
 For this role we are not considering applicants who require relocation and will take into consideration only applicants who are located in Stockholm, and:
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship
* Have a valid work permit for working in Sweden


 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Lead Java Developer
