title: Senior BI Consultant at Cegeka Data Solutions!
description:
Do you enjoy working on a project basis and want to contribute to providing efficient cloud solutions? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing, dynamic, and passionate business intelligence team? Then Cegeka Data Solutions is the right place for you!
  
About the role
  
As a Senior BI Consultant, you will become a part of our Data Solutions team consisting of 15 people. Together with your colleagues, you will be responsible for mapping the customer’s requirements and translating them into designs for dashboards or reports. You will share your vision for the entire BI solution, taking into account important aspects such as governance, compliance, and security.
  
Your tasks will include end-to-end projects within Business Intelligence, where you work with everything from implementing solutions, connecting to data sources, and performing data modeling.
  
In addition, Cegeka is an employer that highly values knowledge sharing, and as an employee, you will participate in internal knowledge groups to develop methods and techniques, share knowledge, and continuously improve our offerings and services.
  
Your background
  
  

**Attributes:**  

To thrive and succeed in the role of BI Consultant with us, we expect that you are a team player with a customer-oriented mindset. You have strong communication skills and are used to communicating with both technical and business-oriented people, making you skilled at translating our customers’ business needs into valuable BI and analytics solutions that meet user demands and requirements. You enjoy coaching junior colleagues and contributing new knowledge and insights to the team. You have the ability to make independent decisions with confidence while being open and humble when the situation requires it.
  
  

**Experience:****We would like you to have:**  

* A completed bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field.
* 10 years of experience building data warehouses both on-prem and in the cloud, as well as experience migrating on-prem solutions to the cloud.
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft’s BI stack, including Power BI, SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
* Extensive experience in executing SSIS projects from start to finish, including developing SSIS packages, configuration, deployment, scheduling, monitoring, and process improvement.
* Experience working end-to-end with everything from integrating data, building data models, ETL, and creating reports using tools like Azure Data Factory, SSIS, and Azure Data Lake Storage.
* Full professional proficiency in Swedish and/or English.


About Cegeka
  
Discover Cegeka, a leader in digital transformation across Europe with over 9,000 employees. With a wide range of groundbreaking digital services and solutions tailored to meet our customers' ever-changing needs, Cegeka is at the forefront of innovation. From cloud services to IT consulting, software development to system integration and infrastructure management, Cegeka offers comprehensive solutions designed to drive businesses forward.
  
With headquarters in Belgium, our reach extends across Europe, sharing our expertise with companies in multiple countries.
  
Cegeka Sweden
  
Our presence in the Swedish market marks the beginning of an exciting journey where we strive to deliver high-quality services and innovative solutions that help our customers succeed. We are committed to delivering personalized digital services that are perfectly tailored to the unique needs of Swedish businesses. With support from our parent company in Belgium, we have access to a wide knowledge base and technical expertise that enables us to meet and exceed our customers’ expectations.
  
With over 60 employees and offices in Stockholm, Linköping, Gävle, and Falun, we strengthen Swedish companies with cutting-edge IT solutions, helping them overcome challenges and achieve success efficiently.
  
We work closely together, and the overall atmosphere is very family-like with close collaboration. We prioritize enjoying time with our colleagues and gather at various conferences, summer parties, Christmas parties, activities, and after-work events.
  
  

**In addition, we offer:**  

* SEK 5,000 in wellness benefits
* Internal knowledge sharing within the office and with Cegeka globally
* Insurance (health, life, accident)
* Benefit cycle
* 30 days of vacation
* DKV health insurance
* Collective agreements


For questions about the position, contact Vilma Hargéus at vilma.hargeus@cegeka.com / 070-1457462. Selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible.

title: SAP Cloud & Power BI-specialist
description:
SAP Cloud & Power BI-specialist med inköpsintresse – var med och forma framtidens inköpsorganisation
  
Om oss
  
Haldex utvecklar innovativa bromssystem och luftfjädringslösningar som ökar säkerhet och hållbarhet för tunga fordon. Vi samarbetar med ledande tillverkare av lastbilar, bussar och släpvagnar globalt samt erbjuder reservdelar och service till eftermarknaden. Med rötter i Landskrona sedan 1887 har vi lång erfarenhet av att skapa banbrytande fordonslösningar. Haldex är en del av SAF-Holland-koncernen med 6 000 anställda globalt.
  
Om tjänsten
  
Vi är mitt i ett spännande skifte – vårt ERP-system byts ut från AX till SAP S4 Hana, och samtidigt bygger vi en ny spend cube som kommer att bli navet i vår framtida, datadrivna inköpsstrategi. Nu söker vi dig som är en riktig magiker på SAP Cloud och Power BI, och som dessutom har ett starkt intresse för inköp och analys.
  
Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att ta fram datagrunder för leverantörsbeslut, inköpsstrategier och hållbarhetsrapportering kopplat till CSRD, CS3D, LkSG, CO₂ och EUDR. Vi letar efter någon som älskar att grotta ner sig i data, bygga strukturer, koppla ihop system och skapa beslutsunderlag i världsklass.
  
Kvalifikationer
  
Du har djup teknisk förståelse för SAP S4 Hana, SAP Cloud, Power BI och gärna tidigare erfarenhet av Microsoft AX. Har du dessutom koll på inköpsprocesser, hållbarhetskrav och livet som inköpare i en komplex, global värld – då är du precis den vi söker.
  
Bli en del av Haldex och väx med oss
  
Hos Haldex erbjuds du en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där utveckling och samarbete står i fokus. Här får du möjlighet att bidra till framtidens hållbara transportlösningar och vara med och bygga upp en nyckelfunktion från grunden.
  
Ansökan och kontaktperson
  
Låter det här som något för dig – eller någon du känner? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Urval sker löpande och sista ansökningsdag är 21 april. Vid frågor om tjänsten, kontakta David Ekström på david.ekstrom@safholland.com. För frågor om processen, kontakta HR-chef Maria Danell på maria.danell@haldex.com.
  
Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Nattreceptionister med erfarenhet från Opera, MEWS & HMS
description:
**Om jobbet:** Nattreceptionist på varierande arbetsplatser i Stockholm. Vi bemannar Stockholms mest attraktiva hotell med alltifrån enstaka pass till längre uppdrag. Arbeta när det passar dig och på den arbetsplats du trivs bäst. Arbetet är nattetid och varierar om du arbetar själv på hotellet eller med kollegor. Tjänsten passar dig som vill kombinera med studier eller annat arbete.
  
Vem är du? Är du en nattuggla som trivs bäst när alla andra sover? Arbetar du kanske redan på ett hotell som nattreceptionist men vill arbeta extra under din lediga vecka? Vi söker dig som har minst 1 års erfarenhet från hotellreception och känner dig trygg med något av följande bokningssystem: Opera, Opera Cloud, Mews, Hotsoft, HMS. Som person ser vi att du är flexibel, serviceminded och ordningsam. Du behöver kunna kommunicera obehindrat på engelska i tal och skrift. Varför ska du jobba på RestaurangAssistans? Att jobba hos oss är framförallt väldigt roligt! Vem vill inte ha hundratals härliga kollegor och möjlighet att jobba på massor av spännande arbetsplatser?
  
Erfarenhet - Hos oss får du snabbt erfarenheter som annars tar flera år att uppnå. Jobba på allt från en till 30 olika arbetsplatser, hos oss finns alla möjligheter! Lär känna nya branschkollegor och skaffa dig ett brett nätverk i branschen!
  
Flexibelt schema - Jobba eller vara ledig? Hos oss får du sms-förfrågningar och väljer själv hur mycket, när och vart du vill jobba. Vi erbjuder både heltid, deltid och extraanställningar!
  
Personalaktiviteter - Få vänner för livet! Vi hittar på massa kul tillsammans för att stärka gemenskapen och visa vår uppskattning.
  
Friskvård och förmåner – Vi erbjuder alla våra anställda oavsett anställningsgrad rabatterade träningskort. Vi erbjuder även rabatt på hotellvistelser i hela Norden!
  
Utbildning - Flera gånger per år anordnar vi utbildningar på olika nivåer. Vi har också ett samarbete med externa parter, bl.a. Restaurangakademien.
  
Trygga och bra villkor med kollektivavtal - Hos oss ingår allt, försäkring, pension och semesterersättning. Dessutom så får du en konkurrenskraftig lön samt tillägg för obekväma arbetstider. Mer om oss RestaurangAssistans är Nordens ledande bemanningsföretag inom besöksnäringen. Vi har funnits i över 20 år och har kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Oslo. Vi bemannar, rekryterar och outsourcar personal till hotellkedjor, stjärnkrogar, företagsrestauranger, kommuner, konferensanläggningar, cateringföretag och stora Arenor.
  
Våra ledord är effektivitet, kvalitet, flexibilitet och omtanke.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As Data Scientist in the Data Analytics and Machine Learning team, you will be responsible for understanding customer usage and performance of our products and for providing solutions throughout the entire product life cycle including pre-, during- and post- development phases.

  

* You will make meaningful interpretations, recommendations and eventually predictions from the data available from various sources to support our endeavor in moving towards data driven development
* Analyze data from test trucks/rig tests to provide quick feedback to the test engineers to ascertain the expected working of the thermal management systems in the trucks
* Develop intelligent dashboards that will help the test engineers to analyze the performance of the thermal system or indicate wrong readings in real time during tests
* Introduce real time interactive capabilities in the dashboards with automation functionalities for extraction of relevant data for various stakeholders
* Support the team to analyze big data from customer trucks to perform root cause analysis for customer product issues and provide a direction towards the solution
* Create, validate and implement advanced truck thermal systems utilization algorithms and its performance trend monitoring tools to enhance predictive maintenance forecasting accuracy
* Perform database queries to support engineering analysis and manage field issues
* Support implementation of dashboards and BI solutions for internal and external customer reporting
* Automating data pipelines and ioT pipelines that will lead to successful development and deployment of Digital Twins
* Work towards edge computing and other concepts to deploy data analytics and ML techniques onboard the trucks to make quick decisions
* Your role will strengthen our Global Thermal Management Sub-Stream and contribute to Volvo Group Trucks Technology vision within this technology area.
**Who are you?**
----------------

 **Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together.**

  

To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a team player, high on energy, and are interested in working with global sites. You have an innovative and creative mindset to recommend engineering solutions and the willingness to learn and develop your own skills and abilities. In addition to this, you hold the below experience:

  

* Bachelors/Masters in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, Computer Science Engineering or equivalent
* Experience in data analytics, machine learning, edge or cloud computing, ioT, etc.
* Ability to leverage analytical and quantitative skills to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, compare against physics-based models and complete root cause analysis
* Excellent exposure to tools like Python
* A passion for turning data into knowledge with great visualizations using Power BI or similar
* Experience in advanced ML/statistical techniques such as regression analysis, neural networks, time series forecasting techniques, classification, clustering, feature reduction etc. especially in automotive applications
* Experience/Knowledge in future technologies (e-MOB, Fuel Cell, H2 technologies)
* Good in compiling and presenting information verbally and in writing.

  

  

Experience in systems, simulations and/or testing of automotive thermal systems is meritorious.

**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


If you want to make a real impact in your career, the transportation business is where you want to be. We look forward to meeting you.

  

For questions about the process, contact Erik Lindberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at erik.lindberg.3@volvo.com. Our hiring manager is Tiago Rosso, Group Manager - Thermal Management, Data and Simulation.  

  

Last application date: **18th of April 2025**

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Group Legal Counsel
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**  

Are you interested in partnering closely with product and business teams navigating complex legal matters to develop and bring to market cutting edge technology in the telecommunications sphere? Then Ericsson’s Technology & Products Legal Affairs team (TPLA) has the opportunity for you.


We are seeking a skilled and experienced attorney for the role of Group Legal Counsel. Strong candidates for this role will have deep technical and legal acumen and experience in the field of emerging technologies, preferably in the telecommunications, networks and cloud services sectors.


TPLA Group Legal Counsel will partner closely with various stakeholders across Ericsson’s global organization, and have the opportunity to work with, tap, and contribute to Ericsson’s deep and diverse network of subject matter experts and Group-wide functions - providing strategic legal guidance at the intersection of law and technology on a wide range of matters including cyber and network security, data handling, strategic alliances, artificial intelligence, trade, competition, commercialization and much more.  

  

**What you will do**  

* Provide strategic legal counsel to Ericsson business and engineering stakeholders in execution of Ericsson’s mission;
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams advising on technology development and commercialization;
* Track and advise on law and regulation impacting the telecommunications and technology industry;
* Draft, review and negotiate agreements, templates, and standardized guidelines and terms;
* Provide legal training and advice to employees at all levels, including senior business executives;
* Develop internal group strategy, policies and programs; and
* Manage external legal resources.


  

**What you will bring**  

* Master of Law degree (or law qualification of equivalent standing, e.g. LLM, JD).
* At least five (5) years working experience as a technology lawyer, preferably with a mix of law firm and in-house experience.
* In-depth knowledge and experience in security, data and emerging technology is preferred, and a passion for staying ahead of technology trends is a must.
* Extensive experience in IT/technology related law and preferably international experience.
* Proven business and technology acumen.
* Interest in and understanding of business strategy, along with proven financial understanding and awareness.
* A team player approach to work - initiating and driving positive change.
* High proficiency in English
 **Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English.  

Last day to apply: 16th of April, 2025  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com


Location: Stockholm, Sweden, UK (all cities, remote work ok) or US (East coast time zone cities, remote work ok)

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: R&D Line Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Product Engineering Unit (PEU) Radio Access Network (RAN) Performance is the R&D team that secures that Ericsson retains world-leading 4G, 5G, and future 6G network performance on both specialized hardware and in cloud deployments.

  

The Product Engineering Group (PEG), Baseband Infrastructure (BBI) is responsible to provide a Run-time Platform (OS) and Software Development Kit (SDK) to enable the full potential of Ericsson Many Cores Architecture (EMCA) and its software developers. We have end-to-end software development responsibility from early phase studies to end of life.

  

PEG BBI has the design ownership for the Baseband Infrastructure SW on our compute and Radio offerings. PEG BBI is a global organization located mainly in Kista, Lund, Linköping, Beijing, Austin, and Ottawa.

  

We are seeking a passionate leader for one of our teams based in Lund. You will be instrumental in our mission to deliver EMCA platform for Open RAN and next generation RAN Compute and Radios. Additionally, you will engage in providing a world-class development environment, including a software platform and tools powered by generative AI, for thousands of Baseband and Radio software developers.

  

As the manager for BBI Section in Lund, you are responsible to evolve the BBI platform software, debug and test framework by leading a diverse team of 20 employees including developers and project leaders. The team Systemizes, Designs and Test new platform functionality within EMCA Software domain. The manager of this unit will also be SPOC towards a selective number of programs.

  

You will report to the Head of PEG BBI and be an important part of the BBI Leadership Team, contributing to the organization’s development in all aspects.

 **What you will do:**

* Ability to think big with long term strategic thinking
* Thrives on accountability, proactive to overcome challenges with a can-do attitude and motivated to achieve beyond expectations
* Authentic, courageous and inspiring leadership with empathy and humanness, whilst building high performing teams and growing tomorrow’s leaders
* Facilitates an open, tolerant, and transparent culture where diverse ideas are valued and realized
* Builds an environment that empowers and motivates people and teams through coaching, setting clear expectations, and providing support
* Manages delegated product responsibility in quality, design, functionality, usability, maintainability, and characteristics
* Business focused and customer-first mindset and ability to proactively build this in org

 **The skills you bring:**

* Strong personal drive and eagerness to contribute both inside and outside your formal responsibilities
* Sound software/ASIC development experience and interest, including Agile practices and embedded software
* Strong, transparent communicator
* Master of Science or corresponding University studies
* Recent successful track record in R&D line management or software development
* Excellent skills in English
* Experience from open-source development
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. title: Senior Product Manager - Audio & Media Playback
description:
Delivering the best Spotify experience possible. To as many people as possible. In as many moments as possible. That’s what the Experience team is all about. We use our deep understanding of consumer expectations to enrich the lives of millions of our users all over the world, bringing the music and audio they love to the devices, apps and platforms they use every day. Know what our users want? Join us and help Spotify give it to them.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Product Manager that will join the Play Product Area within the Core Experience Studio to help evolve the experience of audio and media playback on Spotify. You will help define and evolve the experiences that make playing on Spotify more engaging, rewarding, and valuable for users, creators, and Spotify. Above all, your work will impact how hundreds of millions users experience music and media.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Work with a cross-functional team that looks after our audio playback capabilities.
* Work with engineering, design, data science and user research to ensure the experience is scalable, usable, and useful for a range of strategies.
* Lead multiple projects across the entire product lifecycle.
* Triangulate data and insights to develop a robust product strategy and inform decision-making as well as short- and long-term roadmaps.
* Manage cross-functional and cross-org relationships to keep them informed, receive input, and influence their thinking.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are an experienced product manager with the ability to work with cross-functional teams, lead complex projects across multiple strategies and stakeholders, and make data-driven decisions.
* You are an expert in audio experiences, with a strong understanding of both the engineering aspects of audio processing and editing, as well as their impact on the user listening experience. For example, you understand how features like crossfading and beatmatching influence the flow and feel of an audio session, while also ensuring high overall audio quality.
* Experience from developing video playback experiences (in addition to audio) is a plus; e.g. low-latency video delivery, DRM, and optimizing playback for improved QoE.
* You have led the product work of several products in large tech companies that you can tell us about.
* You have a deep understanding of product practices and know how to incorporate multiple different perspectives (including user research, data and strategy) into one single product vision and experience.
* You care about creating engaging, rewarding, and valuable experiences for users, creators, and Spotify.


 Where You’ll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Solutions Architect
description: The Junior Solution Architect - supports both prospective and existing customers to advance their adoption of dynamic authorization. In many ways, the Axiomatics Junior Solutions Architect acts as a technology consultant who pulls from a security background and leverages their customer engagement experience to speak to the security landscape, architectural models and solutions, while also possessing the ability and business acumen to discuss and present to senior members of a client team. In addition to being an expert in dynamic authorization, the Solution Architect brings a depth of knowledge and experience within the Identity and Access Management space. They will provide subject matter expertise through delivery of workshops, professional services consulting engagements, and as a leader on solution design and deployment projects.

title: Solutions Architect

**Industry**

 Key requirements
 




  




* **Work with stakeholders** 
 to understand the business needs and objectives

 and

 of S/4HANA to meet business requirements

 (REST, OData, etc.) and

 are well-integrated to enable seamless communication across platforms

 **performance of S/4HANA** 
 by managing system resources, handling large data volumes, and reducing system downtimes

title: Konsulter inom försvarsområde
description:
Systecon Konsult är ett ledande konsultföretag inom området Life Cycle Management som hjälper kunder att hitta design- och underhållslösningar som ger system med hög tillgänglighet till låg LCC (Livstidskostnad). Det kan handla om t ex flygplan, helikoptrar, fartyg eller markfordon. Detta görs ofta i stora projekt som antingen nyanskaffar system och materiel, eller modifierar sådant som redan är i bruk. Vi arbetar i uppdrag mot alla delar av Försvarsmakten, just nu med en tonvikt mot den marina sidan, men har även civila kunder som Kustbevakningen och Sjöfartsverket. I arbetet har vi tillgång till Systecons egenutvecklade mjukvara Opus Suite som används av hundratals företag över hela världen för att hitta den rätta balansen mellan tekniskdesign, driftprofil och underhållslösning.
 



  





 Sveriges Försvarsmakt och Totalförsvar växer och vi ser därför en kraftigt ökad efterfrågan på konsulter till flera olika spännande projekt. Den här tjänsten passar dig som tycker om att arbeta med och analysera kopplingen mellan teknik, data och affärsmål och som gärna resonerar dig fram till rätt lösningar i samråd med kollegor och kunder. Vi ser också att du som person gillar att skapa, forma och utveckla kundrelationer.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har några års erfarenhet av teknikprojekt inom försvarssektorn.
* Har tidigare arbetat med driftsäkerhet, Integrated Logistic Support eller modellering och simulering.
* Har möjlighet att utgå från antingen Stockholm eller Karlskrona/Malmö.
* Har civil- alternativt högskoleingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.



  





 Låter det som något för dig? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan tillsammans med ditt CV. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig. Om du har frågor angående våra lediga positioner och framtida möjligheter hos oss är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare, Anna Haglund; anna.haglund@systecongroup.com
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer - Hybrid - Stockholm
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Partner Solution Engineer
description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Senior Partner Solution Engineer** 
 in Stockholm, who is accustomed to working with Systems Integrators. In this role, you will work directly with our consulting & SI partners, enabling them on key platform features and their business benefits and helping them to grow their Snowflake services business and shape their go-to-market.
   

  

 As a Snowflake Senior Partner Solution Engineer, you must share our passion for innovating through the AI Data Cloud, thrive in a dynamic environment, and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives and inspiring technical audiences.
   

  

**IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:**
* Present Snowflake technology and vision to decision makers and technical contributors at partners, prospects and customers
* Work hands-on with partners and customers to demonstrate and communicate the value of Snowflake technology throughout the sales cycle
* Build technical champions within our partners and grow the local Snowflake technical community
* Immerse yourself in the ever-evolving industry, maintaining a deep understanding of competitive and complementary technologies and vendors and how to position Snowflake in relation to them.
* Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing to continuously improve Snowflake’s products and marketing


**ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:**
* 7-8 years of industry experience with a minimum of 3 within a pre-sales environment working directly with consulting & System Integration (SI) partners
* Outstanding presenting skills to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos
* Broad range of experience within large-scale Database and/or Data Warehouse technology, ETL, analytics and cloud technologies
* Hands-on expertise with SQL
* Experience in data science is highly desirable as is hands-on Python experience
* Ability to connect specific business problems and Snowflake’s solutions
* University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred
* Fluency in Swedish and English are required


 Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
   

  

 How do you want to make your impact?
   

  

 For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com

title: Integration Manager, Digital Solutions
description:
**Be visionary**
 Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
   

  

 We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Key Responsibilities**
**As An Integration Manager, You Will**
* Partner with global customers to scope, plan, and implement our enterprise solutions, system-to-system integrations and drive the customer onboarding process.
* Lead customer workshops, training sessions, and user acceptance testing to ensure successful implementations and long-term value creation.
* Collaborate with internal teams (Product Management, Sales, Support, and R&D) to deliver successful projects and ensure alignment with customer goals.
* Develop an in-depth understanding of customer needs, IT environments, and system requirements to set up effective integrations between our solutions and customer CMMS/EAM/ERP systems.
* Act as a technical integration expert, supporting sales efforts by providing technical insights during the sales cycle and customer visits.
* Build extensive expertise in sensor integration, data flows, and creating structures that maximize customer value.
* Work closely with product managers to refine our offerings and develop additional integration solutions and packages.
* Support cross-functional teams to improve documentation, support materials, training resources, and communication strategies.
* Create and maintain a network of experts on other CMMS/EAM systems, contributing to future product enhancements and customer projects.
* Benchmark competitive solutions and provide insights to product management for market-driven innovation.


**What We’re Looking For**
 To excel in this role, you’ll need:
   

  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering or a related field.
* Proven experience in setting up system-to-system integrations through APIs, system configurations, customizations, or middleware.
* Excellent technical skills in system integrations and data management, with a strong understanding of cloud hosting options (multi-tenant, single-tenant, and on-prem).
* A background in Software as a Service (SaaS) is highly desirable.
* Outstanding customer relationship management and communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts clearly to all levels of an organization.
* Strong project management skills, ensuring efficient and professional customer implementation processes.
* Flexibility to travel internationally, accounting for 20-50% of your time.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, to communicate effectively within our global organization as well as our international customers and teams.


**Why Join Us at Teledyne FLIR?**
 As an Integration Manager, you’ll have the unique opportunity to shape the future of enterprise solutions by driving customer success and contributing to innovative product offerings. By collaborating closely with global customers, you’ll gain deep market insights while evolving and streamlining customer implementation processes for maximum efficiency.
   

  

**At Teledyne FLIR, You’ll**
* Develop your career with the world's leading company in thermal imaging and sensing technology.
* Play a pivotal role in building enterprise solutions that deliver success for both our customers and the company.
* Enjoy a dynamic work environment where our broad range of products and sensors come together to create impactful solutions.
* Thrive in a friendly, collaborative culture that emphasizes creativity, problem-solving, and teamwork.


 If you’re driven, structured, and passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences, we’d love to have you on our team!
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.
   

  

 The selection process is ongoing and we may select our final candidate before the advert expires.
   

  

 When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.
   

  

 We accept applications in English
   

  

 (Non-US) This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.
   

  

 Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

company_industry: Information Technology & Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Data Infrastructure and Analytics
description:

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

 As a
 **Cyber Security Architect** 
 , you will be responsible for designing and implementing cybersecurity strategies and solutions to protect the 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) in line with 3GPP security standards. This role involves developing advanced security frameworks and mechanisms for the 5G RAN infrastructure, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the radio interface, user devices, and control planes.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key role in:*
* Leading the design of security architectures for the 5G RAN, incorporating 3GPP security standards and related elements.
* Developing security mechanisms for air interface protection, signaling, and data confidentiality.
* Implementing and optimizing authentication, encryption, and integrity protection mechanisms specific to the 5G RAN
* Applying deep knowledge of 3GPP protocols to secure communication between mobile devices, base stations, and the 5G core network.
* Conducting threat modelling and risk assessments specific to 5G RAN, identifying vulnerabilities in the radio access layer, and proposing countermeasures.
* Assessing security risks in RAN architecture
* Ensuring air interface protection using techniques such as dynamic key management, mutual authentication, and encryption algorithms.
* Working closely with 5G core network security teams to ensure that security mechanisms in the RAN are seamlessly integrated into the end-to-end security of the mobile network.
* Collaborating with security operations teams to monitor, detect, and respond to security incidents affecting the 5G RAN.
* Developing incident response plans for security breaches within the radio access layer and providing guidance on mitigations for emerging threats.
* Leading the design and execution of security testing for 5G RAN solutions


**Your Profile**
* Strong expertise in 5G RAN architecture and 3GPP security standards.
* Experience in designing and implementing cybersecurity solutions for telecom networks.
* Proficiency in 3GPP security protocols, such as authentication, encryption, and key exchange.
* Hands-on experience in Threat modelling, Risk assessment, and Incident response.
* Deep understanding of Radio interface security, Encryption mechanisms, and Regulatory compliance (ISO 27001, GDPR, NIST, etc.).


 Note: You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role.
   

  

**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
   

  

* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the 5G and cybersecurity domain. including professional certifications in cybersecurity and Telecom security.

title: PLM Solution Architect
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) at Ericsson secures a PLM environment that integrates people, data, processes and systems to support an efficient business process. We ensure accessibility, traceability and automation to make data available throughout the entire product lifecycle for different needs with the goal to support Ericsson to meet customer needs in different stages of the product lifecycle. It is about enabling the Ericsson digitalization journey.
   

  

 Solution Area HW within PLM is now looking for a highly skilled and experienced Solution Architect to contribute to the design, development, and implementation of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) solutions in key disciplines: Material compliance, Component mgmt., MCAD, ECAD, Product structure, Release mgmt. and Document mgmt.
   

  

 As a PLM Solution Architect, you will play a critical role in defining a Discipline system architecture, integrating various systems, and ensuring alignment with business objectives. This role requires a combination of technical expertise, analytical skills, and the ability to both drive and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
   

  

 This role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of PLM transformation, driving innovation and efficiency in product development processes.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Solution Design & Architecture: Develop and define the architecture for PLM systems, ensuring scalability, reliability, maintainability and security.
* Technology Integration: Work with the integration of PLM solutions with ERP, CAD, PDM, and other enterprise applications to create a seamless data flow.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with business stakeholders like Configuration managers, Design engineers, and Process owners to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* System Implementation: Oversee the deployment of PLM software, ensuring optimal functionality across all components in alignment with business needs
* Customization & Configuration: Identify necessary customizations and configurations in the PLM platform to enhance efficiency and usability.
* Performance Optimization: Conduct performance analysis and recommend improvements to enhance the overall functionality of the PLM ecosystem.
* Compliance & Standards: Ensure that PLM solutions adhere to industry standards, data security requirements, and regulatory guidelines.


**The skills you bring:**
* Demonstrable ability to drive initiatives and provide technical leadership.
* Strong communication skills to engage effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders and with the ability to collaborate across multiple teams.
* Proven experience as a Solution Architect within PLM projects, preferably within the high-tech industry.
* Knowledge of PLM processes, product data management, and the product development lifecycle.
* Strong understanding of enterprise architecture, system integration, and data management principles.
* Experience with APIs, web services, and middleware solutions to enable system interoperability.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 764574

title: Datacenterkonsult
description:
Vill du bidra med din kompetens inom datacenter, server och lagring? Trivs du med att möta nya människor i nya miljöer, samtidigt som du får stora möjligheter att utvecklas i din yrkesroll? Då är du varmt välkommen till oss på Atea. Just nu söker vi en seniorkonsult inom datacenter till vårt kontor i Stockholm som vill hjälpa våra kunder på deras digitala resa.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I rollen som seniorkonsult inom datacenter, server och lagring kommer du få möjlighet att arbeta med en bredd av olika kunder. Rollen kan innebära såväl längre heltidsuppdrag på en specifik kund som att ha flera spännande uppdrag löpande parallellt. Din roll blir central i att hjälpa våra kunder vidare med deras initiativ inom datacentret med fokus på att aktivt arbeta för att rådge dem i deras resa framåt i tätt samarbete med våra säljare och arkitekter.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Arbeta med design, implementation, felsökning, förvaltning och utveckling av våra kunders datacenter-miljöer och IT-infrastruktur
* Delta i projekt och uppdrag som teknisk rådgivare och/eller utförare samt leverera dokumentation efter utsatta krav
* Agera teknisk specialist och rådgivare (såväl internt som mot kund inom ditt/dina kompetensområden)
* Genomföra förstudier, analyser och workshops ute hos våra kunder
* Samarbeta med våra arkitekter vid framtagandet av design
* Supportera vår specialistsäljare vid framtagandet av lösningsförslag
* Löpande utveckla din kompetens genom utbildning/certifiering i nära dialog med våra strategiska partners samt genom att omvärldsbevaka och uppdatera dig gällande vad som händer på marknaden


**Vem är du?**
 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga kompetenser, som är viktiga för att lyckas i rollen och att du ska trivas hos oss. I konsultrollen är du flexibel och trivs med att samarbeta med andra. Du uppskattar möjligheten att möta nya kunder och arbeta i en varierande vardag. Du är självgående och tar ansvar för dina uppgifter, strukturerar och prioriterar ditt arbete och driver dina processer framåt. Du söker aktivt efter nya utmaningar samt utvecklingsmöjligheter hos kunden, både för egen del såväl som för möjligheter för andra konsultkollegor.
   

  

 För tjänsten som seniorkonsult inom datacenter ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Tidigare erfarenhet av konsultrollen
* Mycket god kompetens inom server och virtualisering (VMware, Hyper-V)
* Mycket god erfarenhet av att arbeta med lagring, dataskydd och hyperkonvergerad infrastruktur, gärna från någon av de större leverantörerna så som Dell/EMC, HPE, IBM eller NetApp
* Har en/flera certifieringar från någon av de större tillverkarna Dell/EMC, HPE, IBM eller NetApp
* Svenskt medborgarskap och obehindrad i svenska och engelska språket i tal och skrift
* B-körkort


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Mycket god kompetens inom Dell´s erbjudande inom server och lagring
* Certifieringar inom ovan nämnda produktgrupper från Dell
* Erfarenhet inom Microsoft Azure
* Kompetens inom Ciscos erbjudande inom server (UCS) och hyperkonvergerade (HyperFlex) infrastruktur


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Marcus Albiin, Konsultchef, via marcus.albiin@atea.se. Ansök redan idag då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Nästa steg i processen består av ett kortare telefonsamtal där dina erfarenheter & kompetenser stäms av och du får chansen att ställa dina eventuella frågor.
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.En anställning hos oss kan även innebära placering i säkerhetsklassat uppdrag. Därmed kan en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll komma att genomföras både före och under anställning.
   

  

 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
   

  

***Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!***
**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Staff Software Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we are on the lookout for a creative Backend Developer to join one of our teams at the forefront of shaping innovative solutions and crafting modern products that positively impact our merchants' lives. If this introduction sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
 PayPal in Sweden originated from Zettle, focusing on commerce services targeting small and medium businesses, and is now expanding to contribute to the wider PayPal portfolio.
   

  

**Meet Your Team**
 PayPal is transforming global commerce. Our Engineering team is the heart of this transformation. We’re building innovative solutions that delight customers and drive business growth. By joining our Identity team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented peers on high-impact projects in an agile environment, designing and implementing backend solutions using the latest Java frameworks.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 We’re not just building systems, we’re creating scalable, high-performance solutions that drive meaningful change in global commerce. We prioritize code quality, customer-centricity, and rapid iteration. Our team collaborate closely with design, product, and QA teams to deliver world-class experiences. As a Backend Developer here, you will be the architect of our global payment platform — designing, developing, and optimizing core systems that power millions of transactions daily, directly shaping both our customers’ experiences and PayPal’s success.
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
 As a Backend Developer, you’ll design and implement robust backend solutions while collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality products. Your day-to-day will primarily involve:
   

  

* Designing and developing scalable backend systems.
* Optimizing system performance and reliability.
* Learning from and supporting other engineers.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Proficiency in Java and solid understanding of core Java concepts.
* Experience with Java frameworks such as Spring (Spring Boot, Spring MVC) and Hibernate.
* Experience designing and implementing RESTful services, with an emphasis on scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and contribute to code reviews and design discussions.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Solid understanding of databases (SQL, NoSQL) and experience with ORM tools like Hibernate.


**Get bonus points if you also have...**
* Experience with large-scale, high-performance systems.
* Knowledge of the payment processing industry and relevant regulations.
* Contributions to open-source projects.
* Familiarity with microservices architecture and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).


**We Believe in You**
 Does it feel like a match? Don't hesitate to apply or/and let's talk – we'd love to get to know you!
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
